n't make a virtual omelet without getting a few eggheads scrambled. This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an` anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust Jude Lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports. "Maybe it's iRon Kirky, or maybe it's payback. Steve Ballmer also believes that the introduction of the Kinect motion controller is beginning to expand the console's appeal beyond that of the male hardcore bedroom gamer-geek. He said: I think about my own family. My wife used to say,` No, no, that's the machine the boys use,' and now she says,` Yeah, I want to go watch movies. Let's go play the dance game' .
